comments:
I was changing perspectives and Eclipse hung. I found this NPE in the log - 
had to kill Eclipse & restart.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Mar 01, 2004 07:58:04.274
!MESSAGE java.lang.NullPointerException
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control.WM_KEYDOWN(Control.java:3385)

Which build is it?  And do you remember which perspectives you were switching 
from/to?  Any other info that would help to reproduce this?

I'm using build I20040226. I rapidly changed from Debug to Team 
Synchronization to Java perspectives. I pressed "team" by mistake, and while 
in the process of switching, I then pressed "Java".
*** Bug 76703 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

It seems this bug is still around and happens on Window 2003, despite the fact 
that we only process key messages in WM_KEYDOWN.  Can anyone recreate it?
I have not seen this since I updated the bug (comment#2)
*** Bug 88281 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Appears to still be happening in 3.1 M5a.

I indeed was pressing Ctrl+O twice and the second time was before the window 
appeared.

Worked around but not really fixed.  Here is the comment:

	/*
	*  Bug in Windows.  Somehow, the widget is becoming disposed after
	*  calling PeekMessage().  In rare cirucmstances, it seems that
	*  PeekMessage() can allow SWT listeners to run that might contain
	*  application code that disposes the widget.  It is not exactly
	*  clear how this can happen.  PeekMessage() is only looking for
	*  WM_DEADCHAR.  It is not dispatching any message that it finds
	*  or removing any message from the queue.  Cross-thread messages
	*  are disabled.  The fix is to check for a disposed widget and
	*  return without calling the window proc.
	*/
